bibdata.title: IEEE Draft Standard for Local and Metropolitan Area Networks Part 16: Air Interface for Broadband Wireless Access Systems (Revision of IEEE Std 802.16-2004)
IEEE Draft Standard for Local and Metropolitan Area Networks Part 16: Air Interface for Broadband Wireless Access Systems (Revision of IEEE Std 802.16-2004)
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Unapproved Draft Std P802.16Rev2/D6 Jul 2008

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: This standard specifies the air interface, including the medium access control layer (MAC) and physical layer (PHY), of combined fixed and mobile point-to-multipoint broadband wireless access (BWA) systems providing multiple services. The MAC is structured to support multiple physical layer (PHY) specifications, each suited to a particular operational environment. The standard enables rapid worldwide deployment of innovative, cost effective, and interoperable multivendor broadband wireless access products, facilitates competition in broadband access by providing alternatives to wireline broadband access, encourages consistent worldwide spectrum allocations and accelerates the mmercialization of broadband wireless access systems. The standard is a revision of IEEEE Std 802.16-2004, and consoidates material from IEEE 802.16eTM-2005, IEEE 802.16-2004/Cor1-2005, IEEE 802.16fTM-2005 and IEEE 802.16gTM-2007, along with additional mantenance items and enhancements to the management information base specifications. This revision supercedes and makes obsolete IEEE Std 802.16-2004 and all of its subsequent amendments and corrigenda.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
